p: Pairwise R ST values did in most cases not differ from the F ST values (Table 6, Additional file 7) (Amiens1 vs Kashmir2, Amiens2 vs Kashmir2, Amiens2 vs Kashmir3, Ghent vs Bremen and Kashmir1 vs Kashmir2: p < 0.05; Kashmir2 vs Kashmir3 p < 0.01; all other comparisons p > 0.05) suggesting that mutation has been of limited importance in differentiating populations both within and between continents. A limited role of mutation in Europe was further supported by the fact that only four private alleles were found in the ten European populations, compared to the 20 private alleles that were found in the three Kashmir populations studied.
